VerUX By: Rey Vera
Software Engineer - UX Designer - Musician

Portfolio

About

     My name is Rey Vera, and I am from the beautiful, and sunny state of California, only to be raised in Tulare county (think dairy cows around every corner). Since agriculture was not a way of life for my family, I knew my educational, and ultimately occupational, choices needed be made based on the ability to adapt to any environement I may find myself in.

     As a child, I was enamored with the process of problem solving, whether that be through playing with legos, or taking apart my mother's blender. Today, I can honestly admit that I cared more about wanting to know how "things" work, rather than how to put it back together. This determined the trajectory for the majority of my education experience from grade-school, through university. It has since become easier to admit my infatuation with science, math, and history!

     This, of course, ultimately lead to undergrad studies at CSU Fresno (Go Bulldogs!) in Engineering, and Mathematics (with a minor in philosophy). During this time, I paid some of my tuition through ethical hacking, web development, and tutoring others in various subjects. I managed to take full advantage of what the university had to offer, to wit, sitting-in on lectures I wasn't enrolled in, thereby leading to a greater understanding in advanced physics, and computer science.

     Of course, the journey doesn't stop there! I find myself constantly in a state of searching for the next big project, or exploring uncharted depths of knowledge. Looking forward to what the future has in store!

Thechurch

The client wanted a site that could be completely self-maintained, while not compromising on it's ability to be feature rich. This led to the decision to use SquareSpace as the Content Management System. After deciding which platform to use, the default template "Alex" was used as a base with modifications to fit the clients exact needs. Specifically, there needed to be an easy way to add the clients logo image to the nav-bar, and home section; and the nav-bar needed to have a mobile variant when the screen size was small enough; and backend JavaScript was implemented to allow for a proper responsive design based on their needs.

  • Client: TheChurch
  • Date: April 2014
  • Service: Web

The falls

The COO/Creative Director of Storm Maker Media reached out for assistance on The Falls Event Center's website. The original site was designed using WordPress as the platform, so the important consideration here was trying to keep as much of the functionality they were used to intact.

  • Client: The Falls
  • Date: October 2015 - Present
  • Service: Web
